wear.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to have something such as clothes, shoes, or jewellery on your body
wear a seat belt (=have it around yourself)
wear.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Susanna was wearing a black silk dress.
Usually I wear black, grey, or brown.
I’m wearing a scarlet dress to the party.
wear something to a party/a dance/an interview etc
wear.translation[0].definitions[0].note_: In everyday English, people often say that someone has something on rather than is wearing something:
She had on a black silk dress.
wear.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to have your hair or beard in a particular style or shape
wear.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: to become thinner or weaker after continuous use, or to make something do this
wear.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: The cushions are starting to wear a little.
His jeans have worn thin at the knees.
You’ve worn a hole in your sock.
wear.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: to have a particular expression on your face
wear.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: His face wore a welcoming smile.
wear.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: the clothes worn for a particular occasion or activity, or by a particular group of people
wear.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: a new range of casual wear
wear.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: damage caused by continuous use over a long period
wear.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: Replace your trainers when they start to show signs of wear.
Check the equipment for wear and tear.
wear.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: the amount of use an object, piece of clothing etc has had, or the use you can expect to get from it
wear.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: The dress stood up to the wear small children give their clothes.
You’ll get years of wear out of that coat.
wear.translation[1].note_box[0].sections: The band were dressed in evening wear.
The company makes stylish casual wear for men and women.
This is leisure wear for active people.
Actresses were dressed in everything from formal wear to miniskirts.
The shop sells comfortable and fashionable maternity wear for every occasion.
the children’s wear section of the store
wear.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: the amount of damage that can be expected to affect a product or property in normal use. Wear and tear is often taken into consideration by an insurance company when paying an insurance claim
wear.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: The sum insured should be based on current replacement costs, less an allowance for wear and tear.
